review: the gk series is one of my alltime favs in the point and click category  overall i am glad i played gk3  it takes some time to get used to the controls and camera views has some very difficult puzzles youll need some hints no doubt  but its definitely worth playing if you are a fan of the franchise and story
game_title: Gabriel Knight 3: Blood of the Sacred, Blood of the Damned

review: one of the best jane jensens works in terms of story and game design the only downside is the voiceover of gabriel somehow the actor made a complete jerk out of him and it is out of character  be warned to play this game today you most likely need to install dgvoodoo drivers otherwise the game will crash a lot it is free though  but the game is highly recommended if you like classic adventure with murder investigations and historical references
game_title: Gabriel Knight 3: Blood of the Sacred, Blood of the Damned

review: very good game if flawed it has both the worst puzzles in adventure gaming history and the best the ending is dark and leaves you wanting more  hopefully there will be
game_title: Gabriel Knight 3: Blood of the Sacred, Blood of the Damned

review: this game this story simply amazing hermetism freemasons  priory of sion conspiracies jensen is seriously involved with esoterism occultism etc dont let the graphics fool you or some minor problems that can easily be fixed this is a great story that is told i really enjoyed this game more than gk1 and gk2
game_title: Gabriel Knight 3: Blood of the Sacred, Blood of the Damned

review: this game has not aged well the voice acting was iffy and the graphics is expected for an older game even on a modern gaming computer the gameplay for clunky and jerky on windows 10 the game would crash constantly between area transitions and i had to save the game regularly to not lose progress however i will still give this game a positive because despite its problems it has a great story line and there were some innovative puzzles in the sidney sections
game_title: Gabriel Knight 3: Blood of the Sacred, Blood of the Damned

review: classic
game_title: Gabriel Knight 3: Blood of the Sacred, Blood of the Damned

review: a game well ahead of its time in terms of quality storytelling and gameplay its a top top franchise the writing and thought placed behind all three games in the series are very detailed it weaves real life knowledge and events with fiction and makes the fictional parts seem believable and even plausible in an alternate reality its been over 20 years but i hope serious thought gets placed in reviving the series and making a part 4  5 and give the series a swansong it deserves
game_title: Gabriel Knight 3: Blood of the Sacred, Blood of the Damned
